title: Co Dinn 2015 French Creek Vineyard Chardonnay (Yakima Valley)
description: This wine comes from 35-year-old vines. Aged on lees for 17 months with 100% malolactic fermentation, aromas of clarified butter, lees, peach, cream, corn silk and spice are followed by medium-bodied fruit flavors that show a pleasing sense of elegance, despite the warmth of the vintage. The lees influence seems a bit intense.

title: Colmello di Grotta 2015 Sanfilip White (Collio)
description: Tropical fruit, tomato vine and hay aromas lead the nose of this wine. The savory palate doles out white peach, grapefruit and lemon drop hints alongside tangy acidity. It closes on an almond note.

title: Colognole 2012 Riserva del Don  (Chianti Rufina)
description: This wine's blue flower, forest floor, toast and tobacco aromas appear in the glass. On the supple palate, polished tannins frame dried black cherry, raspberry compote, cinnamon and licorice flavors. Drink through 2020.

title: Di Filippo 2013  Montefalco Sagrantino
description: This offers subdued baking spice and black plum aromas. It's densely concentrated, showing prune, raisin and tobacco flavors alongside close-grained tannins and the heat of evident alcohol. Drink 2022–2028.

title: Dianella 2015 Riserva  (Chianti)
description: Made from 95% Sangiovese and 5% Colorino, this opens with dark berry, baking spice and leather aromas. The firm palate offers dried black cherry, clove and raw almond touches alongside polished tannins. Drink through 2021.

title: Domaine des Hauts Plateaux 2017 Rosé (Côtes de Provence)
description: Produced by the cooperative of Le Luc, this wine shows an easygoing character. It is ripe and full bodied without missing a beat on acidity and red fruits. It is rounded while still keeping a bright, crisp aftertaste. Drink this tangy wine now.

title: Domaine du Vistre 2017 Cuvée Gladiateur Rosé (Costières de Nîmes)
description: Crisp raspberry and red cherry notes, while subtle on the nose, amass ripeness and concentration on the palate of this lusciously fruity dry rosé. It's juicy and voluptuous, balanced by a brisk, refreshing finish.

title: Domaine Terre de Mistral 2017 Rosalie Rosé (Côtes de Provence Sainte-Victoire)
description: Named after the current winemaker's grandmother, this wine is both fruity and herbal. Its young brightness is balanced with rich berry flavors, tight acidity and a zesty, tangy aftertaste. Drink from late 2018.

title: Dr. Konstantin Frank 2016 Dry Riesling (Finger Lakes)
description: Clean aromas of quince and limestone ride over a riper stone fruit core. Light bodied in feel, the dry palate is taut and focused, with tart apricot, lime and a chalky, mineral tone.

title: Famille Perrin 2014 Les Sinards Red (Châteauneuf-du-Pape)
description: Bold layers of char, vanilla and smoke envelop a core of fresh red cherry and berry fruit in this full-bodied but delicately concentrated wine. There's a vital freshness here, with green, herbal accents that are a touch astringent. Drink now–2021.

title: Fattoria di Grignano 2015  Chianti Rufina
description: This opens with iris, red-skinned berry and thyme hints. The straightforward palate delivers juicy red cherry, clove and cinnamon touches alongside polished tannins. Enjoy through 2021.

title: Filodivino 2016 Serra 46  (Verdicchio dei Castelli di Jesi Classico)
description: This opens with grapefruit and apricot aromas that carry over to the palate, alongside a juicy lemon note. It's bright, with fresh acidity. Drink through 2021.
region_1: Verdicchio dei Castelli di Jesi Classico

title: Grosso Kresser 2012 Reserve Cabernet Sauvignon (Paso Robles)
description: Blackberry sorbet, charred wood and fresh violets show on the nose of this wine, which is already six-years-old but not showing much age at all. Fruity blackberry flavors are cut by a chalky tension on the palate, and that structure carries deep into the finish.

title: Gunter Triebaumer 2016 Zweigelt (Burgenland)
description: Really ripe black cherry on the nose has a tinge of cinnamon. The palate plays a similar game of simple but juicy fruit augmented with some spiciness. This is juicy, fresh and easy. The finish reveals some almost stealthy grip.

title: Gunter Triebaumer 2017 Sauvignon Blanc (Burgenland)
description: Earth and lemon unite on the nose. The palate comes in with immense freshness that is expressive and vivid despite its translucent lightness. Bright lemon is a constant feature from first whiff to dry finish.

title: Jäger 2017 Achleiten Federspiel Riesling (Wachau)
description: A lovely herbal tinge of chervil mixes with the lemony notes on the nose. The palate majors in lemon and has a light, dry and very lemony body. This is easy and refreshing.

title: Kurtatsch 2016 Kofl Sauvignon (Alto Adige)
description: This vibrant white offers elderflower, citrus zest and crushed stone aromas. The linear palate shows white grapefruit and thyme notes set against bright acidity, with a crisp finish.

title: Llano Estacado 2017 Signature Rosé (Texas)
description: Enticing aromas of strawberry and freshly squeezed lemon juice are accented by white pepper on the nose of this blend of 34% Cinsault, 31% Carignan, 22% Mourvèdre and 13% Grenache. Ripe pink grapefruit and strawberry flavors are sunny on the palate, backed by juicy lemon-lime acidity that leads into a clean, zesty finish.

title: Markus Huber 2017 Terrassen Grüner Veltliner (Traisental)
description: A creamy, green freshness on the nose is reminiscent of lemon, aloe vera balm and greengage. The palate is light, and has that same gentle but greenish freshness. This is light, smooth, dry and very refreshing.

title: Meinklang 2016 Zweigelt (Weinland Österreich)
description: Both reduction and cinnamon play on the nose. The palate counters this with very fresh-faced, juicy, easygoing red-cherry fruit. There is lovely freshness to balance all of this cherry fruit and something about this screams picnic, joy and fun.

title: Merry Cellars 2015 Petit Verdot (Columbia Valley (WA))
description: Most of the fruit for this wine comes from Stillwater Creek Vineyard and saw no new oak. Aromas of black cherry, blackberry, dried herb and barrel spice lead to a full-bodied palate with a big blast of acidity and firm, slightly dry tannins. It needs some food alongside it to help tame it but brings appeal.

title: Neudorf 2016 Sauvignon Blanc (Nelson)
description: Relatively quiet yet persistent aromas of tropical and stone fruit, banana, a speck of honey and just a touch of green bean introduce a slippery-textured palate of waxy lemon and grapefruit. The acidity is there, but unlike other examples of New Zealand Sauvignon Blanc, it's not searing or green.

title: Piandaccoli 2013 Cosmus Riserva  (Chianti)
description: Dark-skinned berry, leather and underbrush aromas lead the way in this. The medium-bodied palate delivers red plum, star anise and white pepper notes alongside polished tannins. Drink through 2024.

title: Podere il Pozzo 2015  Chianti
description: This 100% Sangiovese wine has dark fruit and cooking spice aromas. Mirroring the nose, the savory palate delivers black cherry, cinnamon and white pepper notes, with pliant tannins. Enjoy soon.

title: Podere Volpaio 2005 Riserva  (Chianti)
description: This blend of 90% Sangiovese, 5% Canaiolo and 5% Malvasia Nera boasts black-skinned berry, leather and pipe tobacco aromas. The savory palate delivers dried black cherry, carob, mocha and white pepper notes alongside polished tannins and still-fresh acidity. Drink through 2023.

title: Poggio Alloro 2016 Il Nicchiaio  (Vernaccia di San Gimignano)
description: This delicately scented wine opens with white spring flower and wild herb aromas. The juicy palate offers white peach, ripe pear and citrus flavors while a bitter almond note signals the close.

title: Provence Wine Maker 2017 Benji Rosé (Coteaux d'Aix-en-Provence)
description: Named after its winemaker, this wine is bright while also packed with red fruits. The wine has concentration, the result of aging on its lees until bottling, but the red-currant and caramel flavors come through at the end. Drink now.

title: Renegade 2017 Rosé (Columbia Valley (WA))
description: A blend of Syrah, Grenache, Mourvèdre and Cinsault, it shows just a tinge of salmon-copper color. The aromas bring notes of guava, strawberry, pink grapefruit, watermelon and spice. There's just a touch of sweetness, making it all go down easy. Kiwi flavors linger on the finish. A veritable cornucopia of fruit, it brings a whole lot of enjoyment and value. More please.

title: Rock Wall 2016 Heringer Vineyard Red (Clarksburg)
description: This is a well-balanced and well-rounded wine made from almost equal parts Malbec, Mourvèdre and Petit Verdot that tastes nicely dry, lightly tannic and full bodied. It has cranberry and black-cherry aromas, vivid fruit flavors and firm structure.

title: Sculpterra 2014 Bentley Ironworks Cabernet Sauvignon (Paso Robles)
description: Black cherry and blackberry start the somewhat lithe nose on this bottling from 28-year-old vines, topped by dried herbs and black pepper. More cherry and darker elderberry tones arise on the palate, lifted by cola and black-pepper spice. Those flavors are more compelling than the texture, which is smooth but simple.
